recipe.name: Beer Bread
recipe.notes: What they call "quick breads" -- it gets its rising power from the beer and so-called chemical leavening agents,  thereby making it the sort of thing you could actually think about the afternoon you were planning dinner and  still see it on your supper table.  A beautiful recipe as it can be greatly modified by simply changing the beer  ingredient.
recipe.preparation: Mix the dry ingredients together and add the beer into the mixture, folding the ingredients until moistened.  Scrape the mixture into a 8 1/2" x 4 1/2" greased pan and bake 35-40 minutes at 400F degrees or until a toothpick inserted at the center comes out clean.  Allow to cool for 10-15 minutes on a wire rack before serving.
